newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Australian smart card company CTA seeks listing.
newsitem.headline: Australian smart card company CTA seeks listing.

text.p: Australian software and smart card technology company Card Technologies Australia Ltd (CTA) said on Monday it was seeking listing on the Australian Stock Exchange through a A$1 million public share issue.
"The purpose of the listing is to raise our profile and get the potential to raise further capital down the line", CTA managing director David Mac.Smith told reporters.
CTA is offering 3.33 million shares at A$0.30 per share. The issue would bring the total number of shares to 36.24 million, representing a market capitalisation of A$10.9 million.

The company recently completed a A$4 million private equity placement with institutional and private investors and now has some 35 shareholders. A listing on the stock exchange requires a minimum of 500 shareholders.

Card Technologies designs and markets applications and programmes for smart cards and associated delivery and processing systems, but does not manufacture hardware components or the smart card itself. CTA's suite of software is called CiT System.
CTA had operating revenues of A$0.5 million in the six months ending December 31, and made an operating loss of A$1.5 million.
"We are playing in a potentially rapid growing market," Mac.Smith said, but added he could not forecast future revenues.
Prudential-Bache Securities has underwritten the issue, which closes on June 6 for a planned listing on June 18.
